critter

Class CritterGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • critter.CritterGroup

  • public class CritterGroup
extends java.lang.Object

    The Critter Engine Class

    This class encapsulates all the methods relating to the critters. These methods are related to the game logic related to them and their placement.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Justin Asfour

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CritterGroup(int waveNumber)
      The method creates a group of Critter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispatchAllCritters()
      This method deals with placing the critter on the map every 10 milliseconds and getting them ready to begin walking from start to finish.
      Critter dispatchOneCritter()
      This method empties the CritterGroup.
      java.util.Queue<Critter> getGroup() 
      void setGroup(java.util.Queue<Critter> group) 
      void startWalking()
      This method deals with the path finding algorithm to make sure that the Critters make it from the beginning to the end.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CritterGroup

        public CritterGroup(int waveNumber)
        The method creates a group of Critter. The number of critters in each group changes based on each wave. As the player progresses through the game, the number of critters and the type that get dispatched changes instead of the strength of the critters. This is how difficulty is increased with each wave. Final wave is against Boss.
        Parameters:
        waveNumber - This parameter will change whenever the Player finishes a wave

    • Method Detail

      • dispatchOneCritter

        public Critter dispatchOneCritter()
        This method empties the CritterGroup. Its a helper method for the next one which is dispatchAllCritter().
        Returns:
        Critter at head of queue

      • dispatchAllCritters

        public void dispatchAllCritters()
        This method deals with placing the critter on the map every 10 milliseconds and getting them ready to begin walking from start to finish.

      • startWalking

        public void startWalking()
        This method deals with the path finding algorithm to make sure that the Critters make it from the beginning to the end. We will be implementing the A* algorithm to make sure of this

      • getGroup

        public java.util.Queue<Critter> getGroup()

      • setGroup

        public void setGroup(java.util.Queue<Critter> group)
